data.title: Wonderful pizza, great service!
data.text: We wandered in and we are glad we did! It's a subway style ordering system but it's pizza! The salad was generous and fresh and the pizza was amazing. It was fun to get it just like we wanted! It was served hot and fast! Pizza, salads, and two drinks for $20, wow!!

data.title: This place has fresh ingredients and fast service.
data.text: My husband and I went here for lunch, I was on a work trip and he met me downtown.  My coworkers had suggested it.  They were not wrong!  Everything from the meat to the cheese to the sauce was delicious. The line was almost out the door and we still got fast service.  The staff was friendly and the seating was ample.  One pizza was enough for both of us to share;  I got my half with just sausage and cheese, he went for a meat lovers type.  We liked it so much, we went back that same night for dinner.

data.title: Unlimited Toppings!
data.text:
Wish we had found Pizza Studio earlier. We visited on the last evening before leaving Phoenix. It was such a great value! You get to build your own 10" pizza from the bottom up for only $7.99 with unlimited toppings. It's like an assembly station. You choose the crust first. I chose the traditional crust. Then, you choose from 5 different sauces. The tomato blend had a very nice flavor. There are 3 different cheeses. I chose mozzarella, but my husband got a blend of cheeses (he had a feta/mozzarella cheese blend). After the cheese is selected, you have to decide on a list of 20 different toppings. I chose the following: garlic, tomatoes, mushrooms, zucchini, and pepperoni. 

You would think it all ends there, but it doesn't. You get to choose from 5 different seasonings as well as a variety of finishing touches. I added truffle salt and fresh basil. The basil was added after the pizza was baked in the oven. Delish! It was so tasty. I'd create the same pizza over again in a heartbeat. 

The service was pretty quick, but that was because there was only one other couple in front of us. I can see it being very slow during peak hours of the day, but mainly because it takes time to assemble these pizzas. It's worth the wait. It's within walking distance from many of the hotels in that area. Our pizza was still warm after walking back to our hotel.  I totally recommend this place for anyone staying in a hotel at CityScape.

data.title: Great Gluten Free Crust
data.text: This place has amazing Gluten free crust, all the toppings are great along with their service, I'll definitely come back

data.title: Gr8 Pizza
data.text: Probably one of the best pizzas I had, wasnt sure what to get but I knew I wanted something with a little spice. Would definitely go there again when I have the chance. Really enjoyed the idea of putting your own toppings on it to personalize it and only $7.99 + tax?? Definitely worth it

data.title: Design your own Pizza!
data.text: There are several crust flavor choices, several "standard" pizzas, or you can look at the toppings buffet and pick & choose what you want on your personal pizza!  It bakes quickly while you pay and get your beverage and they will bring it to your table or call out your name for "to-go" orders.  They have also added a salad - choose your toppings area too.

data.title: Pizza was okay; salad disappointing
data.text: The pizza was just okay.  I ordered the rosemary crust, but I didn't taste the rosemary.  I also ordered a greek salad, but it didn't have the flavors that I expect of a greek salad.

data.title: Ok pizza, rotton salad lettuce
data.text: Salad station guy was struggling to make my house salad with chicken; salad had rotton lettuce leaves.  Cheese pizza was good.  Strange ordering system, salad line, and pizza line.  We wanted both do had to wait in two lines.  Will go to Fired Pie next time.

data.title: Fast Service, Great Food, Good Price
data.text: This is like Subway for pizza.  Create your customized pizza and in minutes, it's done.  Very good food as well.  Casual dining; friendly staff.

data.title: Better than I expected
data.text: Stopped here after walking around Phoenix on a Sunday afternoon. The place I thought I was going to go for pizza was closed on Sunday (and Monday). This is a small place off a little open courtyard and water play yard in a place called Cityscape. Pizza was really good. I had "the beast" which is several different meats and had it on original crust. Crust was great, not crazy thin but not doughy, lots of air pockets around the rim. All the pizza's are 11 inches and very reasonably priced. Nice to be able to take the pizza out and watch the kids laughing in the water playground. They had several tables around the courtyard and it wasn't too crowded on a Sunday late afternoon.

data.title: Perfect quick pizza
data.text: Had not tried or heard of this place before.  Stopped by during a break at my conference.  It's a quick serve pizza, but not cheaply made.  The dough is prepped in front of you, it's all you want on toppings (or go with their combos), and it's baked quickly.  The crust is just above a cracker crust, not to dried out and not too soft.  I had the chicken alfredo, add some artichoke hearts and pesto sauce and you're good to go.  Overall, nice and clean quick serve personal pizza restaurant.

data.title: Delicious pizza, fast service
data.text: Ordered a cheese pizza and a pepperoni for the kids...Greek salad for me.  Salad was fresh and delicious.  Had to snitch some pizza from the kids.  It was amazing!  Would definitely go back and order my own pizza some time.

data.title: Incredible make your own pizza!
data.text: A great place for pizza when your in downtown Phoenix. Step up into the line, and customize your pizza from several crusts, sauces, cheeses, meats and veggies.  The fact that they have 5 or 6 different crust options as well as super fresh ingredients makes them the best fast casual pizza in the valley in my opinion.  Once made, they throw your pie in a 650 degree oven and it comes out in 2 minutes.  They even have a gluten free crust for those with a gluten allergy.  This place gets super busy during peak lunch times so don't be surprised if you have to wait 10-15 minutes before getting to the front of the line. But trust me it's well worth the wait and prices are very reasonable!

data.title: Pizza Lover Alert !!!
data.text: Terrific product, fresh, delicious, and made on the spot.  Great Prices too! I want a few of these in Pittsburgh !

data.title: A gen of a pizza place in downtown Phoenix
data.text:
This wonderful pizza place in downtown Phoenix is very conveniently accessible from most public transit points, and is walk-able from most major hotels and workplaces in the downtown area. The lines can get very long during the lunch hours on weekdays, but the line moves very quickly and the staff are very courteous and helpful. The customized pizzas are as wonderful as the customers that make them themselves, with the help of the handsome gentlemen behind the food counters.Low-fat, Low-carb, and gluten-free options are available for a small premium. 

Service is very good, and to-go boxes and condiments are very easily available upon demand. I strongly recommend this place to anybody that's hungry for Pizza and has got a money and time budget with a great appetite. Bon Appetite!

data.title: Speciality pizza
data.text: Ordered online pizza due to time constraints and pizza ready and hot when went to pick it up. I ordered the gluten free crust and it was the best crust I have ever had. Selection to order crust type, sauce type, toppings with extra choices at reasonable prices.

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: This place is a great place to get a personal pizza. Reminds me of Subway, but pizza instead.  Very reasonably priced  for the downtown location. This place can be very busy during lunch hours Monday -Friday. I  will be hitting this place up again.

data.title: Thin Crust Pizza Your Way Right Downtown
data.text: You start with 5 crust options including gluten free and then can go to town with many fresh and tasty sauces, cheeses and toppings.  As other reviewers have noted, this is a popular weekday lunch spot.  Fortunately, the very thin crust pizzas bake quickly and the energetic staff all work hard to move the lunch crew through.  This casual place is worth a try especially if some of your party just want basic classics like cheese and pepperoni, and others want to get funky with toppings like goat cheese, pineapple or a Jamaican Jerk spice.  We enjoyed a gluten and dairy free pizza along with a vegetarian Margherita pizza.  A few photos are attached.  Enjoy.

data.title: Best Pizza Combined Best Service
data.text:
"Exceptional" is all that I can say about both the food and service.

Very clean and staff very friendly.

You get to design your pizza in a Subway ® type fashion.

In addition, you get all the toppings you want and they have a wide and varied selection of crust, sauces, vegetables, and meats.

I love this place!  If my waistline didn't mind, I would eat there everyday for lunch.

data.title: Another Pizza Choice in Downtown Phoenix
data.text: Pizza Studio is a fast paced pizza place.  But beware of the line after 11:30 to 12:30 pm.  Try to beat the crowd or come after the crowd.  There are 6-10 employees working to keep up with demand for these thin crust pizzas.  You have a great selection of toppings for your personalized pizza.
